The NAEB After Thirty Years. Dr. Harry J. Skornla. "I want to welcome you
on behalf of the NAEB and wish you a Good Friday. I bring the greetings of
President Frank Schooley, Associate Director Harold Hill, Network Manager John
Holt, your Regional Director Jim Macandrew, Sy Siegel and the many others who
were unable to come. Instead of starting with the announced topic "The LAEB
After Thirty Years," in view of the questions which have arisen about how we
should here proceed, I would like to precede this historical review by telling
you some of the purposes of NAEB regional meetings. One of the strong points of
emphasis in the original grant from the W. K. Kellogg Foundation was that the NAEB
should hold at least one meeting in every region. This Region I Meeting completes
the first round. The first regional meeting, which was Vice-President John Dunn*s
idea, was held in Norman, Oklahoma, March 28-30, 1952 with approximately 20 in
attendance. The Region II meeting was held March 13-14, 1953 in Chapel Hill, North
Carolina with 29 members attending. Incidentally just last weekend approximately
15 or 20 Region II members got together in Atlanta, Georgia for another regional
meeting, this time with all representatives paying their own expenses. The Region
III Meeting was held in Ann Arbor, Michigan, May 22-24, 1953 with 36 members
present. This, too, served as a pump-priming session since, again at their own
expense, on June 10, 1954, the engineers specifically of Region III got together
in Chicago for a one day meeting arranged by George Jennings of MBEZ and Region III
Director Paul Rickard. Thirty-two members attended the Region VI meeting held in
Eugene, Oregon, October 16-17, 1953. Last October 1, 27 members of Region IV met
in .Ames, Iowa.
